items.title: [FEATURE] Ability to select only desired formats and locations on Linux
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I only want the Clap format when downloading

**Describe the solution you'd like**
"If folks don't want to install all of the plugin formats, it's very easy to select only the plugin formats that you want from within the installers on Windows and Mac. I haven't tried to do something similar on Linux, but I imagine it should be possible. For any further customization, I would recommend doing your own local build."

**Additional context**
https://github.com/jatinchowdhury18/AnalogTapeModel/issues/310 inspired by your comment here

items.title: Sticky-shed syndrome [FEATURE]
items.body:
I'd love to have an option to model physical disintegration of tape.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sticky-shed_syndrome

Motivation:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Disintegration_Loops

Do you already have an idea what and where in the code would have to be change to simulate missing or locally thinner pieces of tape?

items.title: [BUG/QUESTION] Inconsistencies In Reported TC-260 Loss Parameters and TC-260 Preset
items.body:
Great plugin overall! I read your original paper, and it has created a bit of confusion for me as to how the Loss parameters work on the preset. In your original paper, you describe the normal operating parameters of the TC-260 as follows:

Gap: 1.5 - 6 microns
Thickness: 35 microns
Spacing: <20 microns
Speed: 3.75, 7.5 ips

However, when I load up your TC-260 preset, which I presume to be the most accurate modeling parameters to the original machine you worked with, the Loss parameters are

Gap: 1.6 microns
Thickness: 4.7482 microns
Spacing: 0.2769 microns
Speed: 15 ips

This plugin setting sounds great, but the analogue purist in me wants to ramp the thickness up to 35 microns and run the tape speed down to 7.5 ips to truly emulate your reported operating parameters. This, however, results in a heavily treble-cut sound that is much darker than what I believe tracks cut to 35 micron thick tape typically sound like. I could be wrong about this, as I have never had the opportunity to work with a real TC-260, but I would appreciate some clarification for how these controls work with respect to the physical modeling of the device.

For example, is the tape thickness setting modeling absolute thickness (i.e. 4 microns emulates 4 micron thick tape) or relative thickness from a baseline such as 35 microns (i.e. 4 microns emulates 39 micron thick tape)? This information would be incredibly useful to know, as I believe it might be fun to try to use the parameters you've created to emulate other types of tape machines, such as the Fostex R8.

Thanks so much for this great plugin and your continued involvement in this community! I hope you can help clarify some of these choices for me.

items.title: [BUG/Suggestion] "Program" is automatable and probably shouldn't be
items.body:
This is more of a suggestion rather than a bug, or maybe it is a bug. Not sure. But I don't think the program selection should be automatable in the DAW. Doesn't make too much sense to me.

**Screenshots**

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - DAW: Ableton Live 11 Suite
 - Version: 2.11.4
 - 32/64 bit (Windows only)

have a clap only download option for linux installer

items.title: [BUG] Mix group reset when loading preset
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
When loading a preset, the mix group is reset to N/A.

**To Reproduce**
Load the plugin on two tracks, set both instances to the same mix group, load a preset in one instance. This instance will have it's mix group set to N/A, the other will stay in the mix group and won't load the preset.

**Expected behavior**
I'd expect the whole mix group to be affected when I load a preset.

**Desktop**
 - OS: MacOS 14.0 (ARM)
 - DAW : Ableton Live / Pro Tools
 - Version 2.11.2

**Additional context**
The plugin sounds great ! Thank you for your work, this is just a minor usability problem (for me anyway).

items.title: [FEATURE] Higher Oversampling Options
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The saturation is great, but certain parameters could benefit from a higher oversampling setting to fight aliasing in the signal.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to have higher oversampling options within the plugin (x32, x64 or even higher) specially for rendering.

**Additional context**
This plugin might be the most convincing tape emulation I've heard, and I feel that with a little more oversampling It could become almost indistinguishable from the real, modeled tape machine. I don't know how hard this would be to implement, so I apologize in advance In case It's too much to ask. I don't want to be entitled or unreasonable. 

Thank you for all you do.

items.title: [BUG] AAX issues
items.body: **Describe the bug** Can't turn the plugin into mid-side mode, and the Azimuth control also appears greyed out. **To Reproduce** Just load the plugin (an an M1 Mac running Pro Tools in Rosetta mode) **Expected behavior** A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. **Screenshots** **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - OS: OSX 12.6.6 - DAW Pro Tools (M1 Max in Rosetta mode) - Version 2023.6 - 32/64 bit (Windows only) **Additional context** Seems to be AAX specific as Ableton Live VST2 seems to work as expected.

items.title: [BUG] Some patches ramp up the audio by +30db
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
I'm not exactly sure how to describe this in detail other than the output just gets blasted when going through certain patches.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
0. Add a limiter after chowtape in your effects chain (Not necessary, but, don't blow your speakers)
1. Play some music and keep changing patches to the right until you get to "Phaser Like". When you go to the next patch, it has a stroke and the output goes up by about 40db. thank god I had a limiter on.

**Expected behavior**
Plugin does not damage eardrums

**Screenshots**
Here's a video. (I have a limiter on the end, and the overall volume is reduced so don't worry about it being loud.
https://safe.fleepy.tv/files/l0rPn3BL.mp4


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - DAW Ableton Live
 - Version 2.11.1
 - 64bit

items.title: [BUG] Chow Tape blocks Davinci Resolve Studio interactions
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
When loading chowtape VST3 on a fairlight track on Davinci Resolve Studio, the whole UI is unavailable, only the Chow Tape controls respond, I haven't found a way to get out of this other than killing the app and all my unsaved progress, been using VSTs on resolve for years without trouble. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open Resolve Studio (I'm using 18.1.3)
2. Create a project with an audio track
3. Switch to fairlight audio view
4. Load a Chow Tape as an FX on a track
5. The Chow Tape window should pop up and freeze the entire UI except itself

**Expected behavior**
It shouldn't freeze the entire UI, nor anything really

**Screenshots**
Not sure this helps but there you go
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20817233/220771803-6cdc11d1-7551-4728-ac68-562bb1bbdea0.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: W11 22H2
 - DAW Davinci Resolve Studio 18.1.3
 - 2.11.1 & 2.11.2
 - 64 bit

**Additional context**
Using Dual screen on resolve, but no problem with any VST

items.title: WowFlutter: Use SVF instead of IIR LPF for Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process
items.body: The IIR filter was having numerical stability problems at higher sample rate (see #302).

items.title: Crash when using Sink->Lofi preset / Flutter Depth [BUG]
items.body:
After switching to the Sink->LoFi Plugin the plugin crashes in the next few seconds both in Ardour7 and standalone.
The left channel goes silent shortly before the crash.
The crash also happens if you use the default preset and crank Flutter Depth up a bit.

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
- Open the plugin, (connect to audio source if standalone)
- switch to Sink->LoFi
- wait a few seconds

**Expected behavior**
It should continue to work.

items.title: [BUG] Found a typo in WowFlutterMenu.cpp
items.body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44263494/213183117-e8ce877e-f98d-4140-bde7-23d43afe104f.png)

I noticed that this variable is called "snycToTapeSpeed", not "syncToTapeSpeed"

items.title: LV2: Support stereo mode only
items.body:
LV2 does not support setting number of channels dynamically, so, to avoid confusing hosts with 36-channels plugin and to preserve compatibility with older LV2 plugins, the LV2 plugin now reports supporting stereo mode only.

Refs. https://github.com/jatinchowdhury18/AnalogTapeModel/issues/283

items.title: Fix dead comments in FIR filter, and bump version number
[BUG] Rendering freezes in Cubase
items.body:
**Describe the bug**
Hello! Love the plugin but i've been having this issue with it for the past months: Every time I open it in Cubase it freezes Cubase and the plugin, if I Ctrl+Alt_Delete then the plugin unfreezes until I click Cubase, which then freezes them both again. after a bit the Ctrl+Alt Delte trick stops helping and i am forced to shut down Cubase and reopen it. When the plugin is inside the project but CHOWTAPEMODEL window isn't open then it works fine. I've tried uninstalling and reinstalling multiple time but it doesn't help. opening the standalone app on my desktop works fine.

I really am fan of your plugins, and this one in particular is my favorite of yours, I've refrained from using it since this bug showed up but I'm working on a project that desperately need its sound, hope you can help, thank you and have a great day!

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 10
 - DAW Cubase 10 Pro
 - Chow Version V2.11.0
 -64 bit (Windows only)

items.title: [FEATURE] Build command excluding CLAP on building instructions
items.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

RPi users **cannot build** AnalogTapeModel because of `cmake_minimum_required`

`CMake Error at modules/clap-juce-extensions/CMakeLists.txt:13 (cmake_minimum_required):
  CMake 3.21 or higher is required.  You are running version 3.18.4`

This problem is caused by the build CLAP.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Add command to turn off the build CLAP like BYOD.

items.title: Upgrade CodeSee workflow to version 2
items.body:
[CodeSee](https://codesee.io) is a code visibility platform. 

This change updates the CodeSee workflow file to the latest version for security, maintenance, and support improvements (see changelog below).

That workflow file:

  - runs CodeSee's code analysis on every PR push and merge
  - uploads that analysis to CodeSee. 
  - _It does __not__ transmit your code._

The code analysis is used to generate maps and insights about this codebase.


CodeSee workflow changelog:

  - Improved security: Updates permission to be read-only.
  - Improved future maintenance: Replaces the body of the workflow with a single github action: [codesee-action](https://github.com/Codesee-io/codesee-action). This makes it significantly easier for CodeSee to introduce future improvements and fixes without requiring another PR like this.
  - Improved Python support: The action now properly supports Python 3.11, and will continue to support new Python versions as they are released.

items.title: Title fixed (paragraph 107)
